context_evidences: - "Trump’s first donation — of $78,333 — in 2017, to the National Park Service, did go toward a pair of projects at the Antietam National Battlefield — which houses the Antietam National Cemetery . But the Interior Department said the money, along with other funds, would be used to “ restore the historic Newcomer House on the Antietam battlefield, and will underwrite the replacement of 5,000 linear feet of deteriorated rail fencing along the Hagerstown Turnpike.” Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2018/08/false-stories-revive-claim-about-trump-salary-donation/ published on 2018-08-07 16:10:23

- Two years ago, in September 2017, following Hurricane Harvey’s devastation in Texas, Trump personally pledged to donate $1 million for relief efforts there. The White House at the time officially announced a list of organizations that would receive donations and the amounts for each. Several organizations later confirmed that they had received the money. Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2019/09/trumps-history-of-hurricane-relief-donations/ published on 2019-09-20 14:39:54

- And here’s where else Trump’s salary has been directed, as confirmed for us by a White House spokesman: Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2018/08/false-stories-revive-claim-about-trump-salary-donation/ published on 2018-08-07 16:10:23

- Also in September 2017, Trump’s inaugural committee announced that it would donate $3 million divided evenly to three organizations involved in hurricane relief efforts — a pledge that was reflected in the committee’s subsequent tax filings . Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2019/09/trumps-history-of-hurricane-relief-donations/ published on 2019-09-20 14:39:54

- The exorbitant rates charged to the Secret Service and agents’ frequent stays at Trump-owned properties raise significant concerns about the former President’s self-dealing and may have resulted in a taxpayer-funded windfall for former President Trump’s struggling businesses. Reference: https://oversightdemocrats.house.gov/sites/democrats.oversight.house.gov/files/2022-10-17.CBM%20to%20Cheatle-USSS%20re%20Exorbitant%20Charges%20at%20Trump%20Properties.pdf published on 2022-10-17 00:00:00

- For several years, the Committee has been investigating former President Donald Trump’s attempts to personally profit off his presidency, including by charging the Secret Service exorbitant rates when protecting the President and members of his family at Trump Organization properties. Reference: https://oversightdemocrats.house.gov/sites/democrats.oversight.house.gov/files/2022-10-17.CBM%20to%20Cheatle-USSS%20re%20Exorbitant%20Charges%20at%20Trump%20Properties.pdf published on 2022-10-17 00:00:00
correction_response: This tweet is partially correct and partially misleading. It's true that Donald Trump charged the Secret Service to stay in his hotels, as confirmed by the House Oversight Committee (https://oversightdemocrats.house.gov/sites/democrats.oversight.house.gov/files/2022-10-17.CBM%20to%20Cheatle-USSS%20re%20Exorbitant%20Charges%20at%20Trump%20Properties.pdf). However, it's incorrect to say that Trump did not donate his yearly salary. He did donate his salary, but not to one specific cause or in one lump sum. Instead, he donated it in quarterly increments to various government initiatives (https://www.factcheck.org/2018/08/false-stories-revive-claim-about-trump-salary-donation/). The tweet does not provide sources for the claims about Trump's and his family's earnings, so these cannot be verified.
note_1_text: Forbes has verified that Trump donated at least 14/16 of his quarterly salaries, or about $1.4 million after tax, to different federal agencies.   https://www.forbes.com/sites/adamandrzejewski/2021/02/27/president-donald-trump-probably-donated-his-entire-16m-salary-back-to-the-us-government--here-are-the-details/amp/
note_2_text: Media organizations at the time verified that former President Trump did in fact donate to federal agencies each quarter an amount representing his after-tax paycheck. https://www.wtol.com/article/news/local/verify-yes-trump-has-never-taken-a-presidential-paycheck/512-31053f37-6add-418b-86d9-043ce905185c
queries:
1. Did Donald Trump donate his presidential salary?
2. How much did the Secret Service pay to stay in Trump's hotels?
3. How much money did Donald Trump, Jared Kushner, and Ivanka Trump make during Trump's presidency?
refute_evidences: - "The president in May donated his salary for the first quarter of this year to the Department of Veterans Affairs, Press Secretary Sarah Sanders announced in a press briefing. VA Secretary Robert Wilkie said the donation had been earmarked for “ caregiver support in the form of mental health and peer support programs, financial aid, education training, and research.” Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2018/08/false-stories-revive-claim-about-trump-salary-donation/ published on 2018-08-07 16:10:23

- But while the president does donate his salary to different government initiatives each quarter, no donation to date has been specifically made to repair military cemeteries. Nor has he donated $400,000 — a whole year’s salary — to one specific cause. Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2018/08/false-stories-revive-claim-about-trump-salary-donation/ published on 2018-08-07 16:10:23

- Previous hoaxes have falsely claimed that Trump and his family donated $1 billion to a fund for a wall at the southern border ( they didn’t ) and that the president donated a whole year’s salary to “repair military cemeteries” — which is false, though he does donate his salary to various causes in quarterly increments, as we’ve explained . Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2019/09/trumps-history-of-hurricane-relief-donations/ published on 2019-09-20 14:39:54

- But there is no proof to support the assertion that Trump has personally donated $1 million to fund hurricane relief in the Bahamas. Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2019/09/trumps-history-of-hurricane-relief-donations/ published on 2019-09-20 14:39:54
tweet_text: NO SHIT: Donald J. Trump did NOT donate his yearly salary when he was president. He also charged the Secret Service $1.4 million to stay in his hotels. He made $1.6 billion as President of the United States and Jared and Ivanka made $2 billion while working in the White House.
user_description: I’m here to fight against the GOP. Must love dogs and democracy.
